articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russian and Ukrainian officials are due to sit down on Monday in the Turkish city of Istanbul for their second round of direct peace talks since 2022, but the two sides are still far apart on how to end the war and the fighting is stepping up.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine to talk about peace but are still far apart

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senior Russian security official Dmitry Medvedev said on Tuesday that the point of holding peace talks with Ukraine was to ensure a swift and complete Russian victory.
articles.title: Medvedev says Russia seeks victory, not compromise, in talks with Ukraine

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Koreans will elect a new president on Tuesday to cap six months of turmoil triggered by a shock martial law briefly imposed by former leader Yoon Suk Yeol that marred the country's reputation as a vibrant, if at times chaotic, democracy.
articles.title: South Koreans vote for president after months of turmoil triggered by martial law

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: At least 27 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded by Israeli fire near a food distribution site in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said, in the latest bout of chaos and bloodshed to plague the aid operation.
articles.title: At least 27 Palestinians killed near Gaza aid site, medics say

articles.author: Bart Meijer
articles.description: Dutch far-right leader Geert Wilders' PVV party left the governing coalition on Tuesday, in a move that is set to topple the right wing government and will likely lead to new elections.
articles.title: Dutch far-right leader Wilders quits coalition, toppling government

articles.author: Leah Douglas, Ted Hesson, Nathan Layne
articles.description: The remark was made during a briefing by David Richardson, who has led the Federal Emergency Management Agency since early May.
articles.title: FEMA staff baffled after head said he was unaware of US hurricane season, sources say

articles.author: Jessica Donati, Sonia Rolley
articles.description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels in Democratic Republic of Congo executed at least 21 civilians over two days in February in the eastern city of Goma, Human Rights Watch said in a report published on Tuesday.
articles.title: Rwanda-backed rebels in Congo executed civilians, Human Rights Watch says

articles.author: Abhijith Ganapavaram, Nandan Mandayam
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's high-profile attendance at a global airlines conference this week underscores how much India is banking on a boom in aviation to support wider development goals, but headwinds to its ambitions are gathering force.
articles.title: Modi's soaring Indian aviation ambitions face many headwinds

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: U.N. inspectors monitoring Iran's Fordow nuclear site confronted a major gap in their knowledge last year as they watched trucks carrying advanced uranium-enriching centrifuges roll into the facility dug into a mountain south of Tehran.
articles.title: Any Trump deal with Iran must tackle nuclear watchdog's blind spots

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin, Emma Farge
articles.description: The United Nations human rights office said on Tuesday that the wilful impediment of access to food and relief for civilians in Gaza may constitute a war crime, describing attacks on civilians trying to access food aid as unconscionable.
articles.title: Wilful restriction on Gaza food aid may constitute war crime, says UN rights office
